intro: Ratibida tagetes, commonly known as the Mexican sunflower, is a herbaceous plant native to Central America. It is characterized by its bright orange to red ray florets and yellow disc flowers, which resemble a large, showy daisy. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 meters and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and often branching. Ratibida tagetes is known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
